25_08_01.gpx.name: Westfjords Day 7: Short pedal into Borgarnes for a bus back to ReykjavÃ­k

25_10_29 Putney -- Surrey Hills.gpx.name: 29/10/25 Putney -> Surry Hills
25_10_29 Putney -- Surrey Hills.gpx.desc: Bit of a late start out of London but good to make some ground towards Portsmouth - we got a ferry to catch! Richmond Park was a lovely route out of the city. As usual getting on the bike makes all the fuss worthwhile :)

25_10_30 Surry Hills -- Portsmouth.gpx.name: 30/10/2025 Surry Hills -> Portsmouth
25_10_30 Surry Hills -- Portsmouth.gpx.desc: A frosty morning, but a lovely start through some leafy trails. Then much of the day on quiet winding backroads through the South Downs National Park, until the industrial reaches of Portsmouth (good cycling infrastructure beside much of the freeway though). Arrived with plenty of time to spare. Free pastries from the Yew Tree cafe in Goldaming was a treat.

25_11_01 El Puerto de Bilbao -- up the h.name: 01/11/2025 El Puerto de Bilbao -> up the hill from Elaxalde
25_11_01 El Puerto de Bilbao -- up the h.desc: Rolled off the ferry and into Santurzti for a long coffee break to get reacquainted with solid ground ðŸ¤¢ Then meandered upriver enjoying Bilbaoâ€™s vibe. The climb straight out of (Plaza Nueva?) came as a shock with our route sending us up some 20% alleys on el Camindo de Santiago (northern route). Then the wet set in, and when the dark did too we pulled up short for the night beside a council water pumping station in some hills (hoping this wonâ€™t offend anyone (Basques). Following Vuelta de Vasco for a few days: https://bikepacking.com/routes/basque-bikepacking-vuelta-de-vasco/

25_11_02 Elaxalde -- Mutriku.gpx.name: 02/11/2025 Elaxalde -> Mutriku
25_11_02 Elaxalde -- Mutriku.gpx.desc: After a bit of slipping and sliding in the mud, bailing on to the very pleasant roads with all the other cyclists was a great idea. As was coffee and pintxos at the first cafe en route in Guernica. A very pleasant day of road riding followed, through ever-more picturesque coastal Basque towns.

25_11_04 Mutriku -- Donastia, San Sebast.name: 04/11/2025 Mutriku -> Donastia / San SebastiÃ¡n
25_11_04 Mutriku -- Donastia, San Sebast.desc: A mere 4km before coffee and treats - getting used to this. More coastal roads, more pretty coastal towns, some silly hike-a-bike in the route that weâ€™re going to try to forget. The high ridge of Mt Igeldo after dark was atmospheric before dropping into Donastia / San SebastiÃ¡n.

25_11_05 Donastia -- Leitzaran valley.gp.name: 06/11/2025 Donastia -> Leitzaran valley
25_11_05 Donastia -- Leitzaran valley.gp.desc: Just an arvo session rolling out of Donastia / San SebastiÃ¡n, then onto a lovely vias verdes, i.e. rail trail, for a pleasant, gentle climb along the Leitzaran river. A disused train tunnel made for a welcome camp out of the rain.

25_11_14.gpx.name: 14/11/2025 LogroÃ±o -> Ribafrecha
25_11_14.gpx.desc: Good to get a few kms done after a day dominated again by some productive admin. It was pleasant to ride through dusk.

25_11_15.gpx.name: 15/11/2025 Ribafrecha -> Refugio Monte Real
25_11_15.gpx.desc: Pretty nice for a day of basically nonstop climbing! The podcasts help. Up the Leza river CaÃ±on and then onto the Sierra del a Cebollera. Some pleasant gravel and weather up until the last 5km when both turned, but hard to stay feeling sorry for yourself in a hut. Made a good new addition to the camping recipe book: shepherds pie.

25_11_16.gpx.name: 16/11/2025 Refugio Monte Real -> near Cornago
25_11_16.gpx.desc: A good feeling to wake up to a view you couldnâ€™t see the night before. A cold morning up high but a nice decent down from the pre-alpine scrub into forest, then further down into scrub again, with a Mediterranean feel. After coffee, tapas, and a look at the dinosaurio footprints in Enciso, didnâ€™t make it far up the road before suddenly it was dark - not sure where the time went (well, to the sleep in and tapas I think).
